benchmark_details.name: CounselBench
benchmark_details.overview: CounselBench is a large-scale benchmark developed to evaluate and stress-test large language models in realistic help-seeking mental health scenarios, consisting of two main components: COUNSEL-BENCH-EVAL with expert evaluations of answers and COUNSEL-BENCH-ADV for adversarial testing.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a clinically grounded framework for benchmarking large language models in the context of mental health question answering.

data.source: Questions sourced from the public forum CounselChat and evaluated by licensed mental health professionals.
data.annotation: 100 licensed mental health professionals provided evaluations, span-level annotations, and written rationales.

methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on expert ratings on a 5-point or 4-point Likert scale, with specific categorizations for Medical Advice.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in providing appropriate, empathetic, and informative responses to mental health queries.
methodology.validation: Expert evaluations were conducted by 100 licensed professionals across diverse mental health disciplines to ensure reliability.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential harm from unauthorized medical advice, overgeneralization, and lack of empathy in responses.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data collected from CounselChat was anonymized, and identifiers were removed prior to analysis.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: All data is sourced from MIT-licensed CounselChat dataset.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Human annotators provided informed consent for participation and data release.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The study was approved as exempt by the Institutional Review Board of the University of Southern California.
